result.execSummary:
The defendant Dean W Hermosillo #615832 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: Ashland County Cases 12CF151,14CM5,16CF18 and 16CM34
Concurrent with: Ashland County Case 16CF109

superMiscConds.notes:
Def to obtain a mental health assessment & follow all recommendations.
  The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
 Take Prescriptions as prescribed.
  Not to associate with any known drug users or those involved in trafficking, other than in a professional group counseling setting or meeting or in a correctional setting.
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

supervisions.notes:
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
Consecutive to: Ashland County Cases 12CF151,14CM5,16CF18 and 16CM34
Concurrent with: Ashland County Case 16CF109

records.addlTxt: from Hearing on February 9th, 2017 for cases 16CM34, 16CM107, 16CF109, 16CF18
States Sentencing and Sentencing after Revocation Recommendation
Defendant Dean W Hermosillo in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Mark L Perrine in court, defendant Dean W Hermosillo not in court, in custody appears via phone.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CF188,16Cf108,16CF109,16CM34,16CM107. Atty comments there is an agreement. No PQ signed. Ct can ask def the questions on the PQ. wants to proceed by telephone. Ct finds that the def is know and vol giving up right to be here in person. DA comments the agreement to cases as follows 16CF108 DRI. 16CF109 plea to Ct 1 and ct 4 and dri counts 2 and 3. case 16CM107 plea to count 2 and counts 1 and 3 will be DRI. The parties will request a PSI with both sides free to argue.  Ct comments 16CF109 has a right to have a prelim hearing. Def understands prelim and rights to prelim. no threat or force to give up right to prelim ct finds know and vol waives right to prelim. Ct finds prob cause the fel was committed in Ashland Co  bound over for argument. 16CF118 16Cm34 these are not open files these are revocation files will hear all the cases at once for SEH. On record- info filed in case 16CF109.  Understands charges and pentalites. PLEAS NC to the 3 counts. admitts he is a repeater . The following charges are DRI. both counts in 16CF08 counts 2 and 3 in 16CF09 and counts 1 and 3 16CM107. understands elements of each crime. no threat or force to plead NC. CT questions def on PQ  wants ct to accept plea of NC. CT finds accepts pleas of NC and finds G.  CT orders a PSI. 2018 is his discharge date. Def would like to appear in court for SEH Hearing. Ct will order a transport.  1/31/17 PSI filed by. no author and short form. order for transport. Atty request that the def be here 24hrs before hearing. granted.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 9, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Mark L Perrine in court, defendant Dean W Hermosillo not in court, in custody appears by phone.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty comments there is an agreement for pleas. would like plea hearing - def would appear by phone or video for that hearing.  CALl green bay set up def to appear by phone or video for hearing  Plea hearing scheduled for November 30, 2016 at 10:30 am.
